resources.string: 1. A player may make one move per turn by placing a wall or moving their pawn.
2. When a player runs out of walls they must move their pawn.
3. The pawn can move one square: forwards, backwards, left or right.
4. The pawn must move around the walls.
5. The walls must not be placed in a manner that they completely block a players path to the goal.
6. When two pawns are on neighboring squares the opponents pawn can be jumped. If a wall is behind the pawn getting jumped, the player can move diagonally to either side of the jumped pawn.
7. The game is complete when a player has moved their pawn to the opposite end of the game board.
